div.l: As grete as it had be a thondir dent
Þat wᵗith þe strook he was almost blent
And he was redy with his iren hoot
And Nicholas into þe ers he smoot
Of goth þe skyn a handbrede about
The hote Culter . brent so his tout
That for þe smert he went for to die
As he were wood for woo he gan to crie
Help water . water for goddes hert
Þis Carpynter out of his slomer stert
And herde oon crie water . as he were wood
And thowth allas now comyth Noes flood
He sett hym vp wᵗithout wordis moo
And wᵗith his axe he smote þe corde atwo
He fel doun to þe flore ⁊and þer aswoun he lay
Vp sterte anon / Alison and Nicholay
And cride out and harowe in þe strete
The nyghboures þo boþe smale ⁊and grete
In ronne for to gaure vpon þis man
Þat in Swownyng lay / pale and wan
For wᵗith the fall he brokyn had his armes
But stonde he moste to his own harmes
For when he spake he was anon bore doun
Of hende Nicholas / and of Alisou
Þei tolde eủery man þat he was wood
He was agast so of Noes flood
Through fantesye / þat of his vanite
He had brouth hem knedyng tubbes thre
And had hem hanged in þe roof aboue
And þat he pᵃyd hem for goddes love
To sitt in þe roof for Companye
The folk gan lawgh at his fantasie
Into þe roof þei loken and þei gape
And turned all his harmes vnto a iape
For what so þat þis Carpenter answerd
It was for nowth / noman his reson herd
Wᵗith othes grete he was so sworn adoun
Þat he was holden wood þrowgh al . þe Toun
For . eủery Clerk anon right helde wᵗith other
And seide þe man was wood my lefe broþer
And eủery wyght gan lawgh att this strife
Thus swyued was þe Carpynters wife
For . all his kepyng and his ielousie
And Absolou hath kissed here neþer eye
And Nicholas is scalded in the toute
Myn tale is dou and god safe al . þis route
Explicit fabula molendinarij
Hic incipit ꝓprologus fabule p̉repositi
When̄ folk had laughed at þis nyce cas
Of Absolon and of hende Nicholas
Dyuerse folk dyuersly they seyden̄
But for þe more part þei loughen ⁊and pleiden̄
But att þis tale / I sawe no man hym greve
But it were only Oswold the Reve
